title: Regcm fixes
body:
I've found a couple of small fixes to do in the package RegCM.


I don't know whether the fix for the intel fortran compiler is correct:
https://github.com/exactlab/spack/blob/06522062e09dc99e35ac5488882aa419acd22e12/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/regcm/package.py#L76-L77
Should I check only for the ifort compiler, like I did for the gfortran compiler issue just above?
```python
    if self.compiler.fc.endswith('ifort'):
        args.append('MPIFC' + ...)
```
Because the fix I propose wouldn't work on a mixed toolchain, like clang + ifort (but I think this is less common than a mixed toolchain clang + gfortran).
Is there a proper way to perform these kind of checks?


Moreover, the actual RegCM version doesn't work with Intel (it crashes with a runtime error).
The new version is expected to be released in a couple of months, but meanwhile you can try adding:
```python
    version('4.7.1-SVN6884',
            sha256='fd4eb0fbe911c6c4dacbaaf2a952a45ac8c1fa54a5d905972ffe592e47818c00',
            url='http://clima-dods.ictp.it/Users/ggiulian/RegCM-SVN6884.tar.gz')
```
